messages.subject: Re:Why I overreacted
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/18/2002 6:01:53 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... Athena, brain tumors are a pretty good reason to be shaken up. I recognize that it s likely
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/18/2002 6:01:53 AM Eastern Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:


> I'm sorry for overreacting to what was really no big deal. My coping skills
> pretty much flew out the window yesterday when I learned that my brain
> tumor
> has come back. I know that's no excuse to be rude. I guess I am just
> shaken
> up a bit more than I realized. I don't know what the future holds. Please
> accept my apology.
>
>
Athena, brain tumors are a pretty good reason to be shaken up.

I recognize that it's likely that you're dealing with a totally different
type, etc., but my partner many years ago had a brain tumor she was not
supposed to survive six months. Obviously, she's around. If it would help, I
think she'd be happy to e-mail with you. Just let me know, and if there's
anything else we can help with, please tell us.

Kathryn (mama to Julian, partner to the still-kickin' Beth)


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: Why I overreacted
messages.msgSnippet: ... Hello Athena. I m coming out of lurkdom to let you know that I ll be holding you in my thoughts. I can only imagine how stressful this time must be for
messages.messageBody:
>>I'm sorry for overreacting to what was really no big deal. My coping
>>skills pretty much flew out the window yesterday when I learned that my
>>brain tumor has come back.>>

Hello Athena. I'm coming out of lurkdom to let you know that I'll be holding
you in my thoughts. I can only imagine how stressful this time must be for
you. I'll be sending positive healing energy your way, as I'm sure just
about everyone on this list will be. Hang in there and be good to yourself.

~Mary
